title: Myles Standish State Forest Road Race
Massasoit Lung Challenge
description: Saturday, April 23, 2011. The return of the Massasoit Lung Challenge Mountain Bike Race from the 1990’s was a long time coming but is now back for the 2nd year as a fundraiser for the American Lung Association. The traditional spring race works well with the sand based soil of cranberry land and has a tendency to dry out much quicker than other parts of New England.
course: The 7.1 mile course is a large clockwise loop with lots of fun single track, some fast double track and a very limited amount of smooth pavement. The terrain is most difficult in the early part of the loop before becoming more rolling in the middle with a couple of short kickers at the end.
registration: On line Registration is available on BikeReg.com. Day of registration will be located near the gatehouse on the paved road entering the Park. Day of registration fee add $10.
notes: It\'s a great course rain OR shine. Pre-rides before race day encouraged.
directions:
Massasoit State Park 1361 Middleboro Ave. East Taunton, MA 02718. 
FROM ROUTE 24 in Raynham take exit 13 to Route 44 East. Go 2.7 miles and turn right (just after Grampy’s Gas Station) on Richmond St. Go 1.2 miles and turn right on Middleboro Ave. Massasoit will be on your left in .3 miles. 
FROM ROUTE 495 in Middleboro take exit 5 to Route 18 South. Go .5 miles and turn right (sign for camping) on Taunton Ave. (becomes Middleboro Ave.) Go 2 miles and Massasoit will be on your left.

title: CYCLE Kids Breakaway
description:
In celebration of National Bike Month, CYCLE Kids is hosting our First Annual Breakaway Bike Ride and gourmet luncheon to raise money to get kids on bikes and on their way to living healthy and active lives!  
 
With the help of the Charles River Wheelmen, CYCLE Kids has put together three beautiful rides for you to enjoy on a New England spring morning. The rides all leave from the deCordova Museum and Sculpture Park in the historic town of Lincoln, a rural community only 20 miles from downtown Boston. The two shorter rides wind through pastoral Lincoln, Concord and Sudbury. The metric century will take you past beautiful vistas by the Fruitlands Museum in Harvard and challenge you with more than 3,000 feet of climbing among the hills of Harvard.
 
Following the ride, relax and listen to bluegrass music.  Enjoy a luncheon on the picturesque grounds of the deCordova museum prepared by Best of Boston chef and restaurateur, Paul O’Connell of Chez Henri.  Chez Henri has the recent honor of being named the most romantic restaurant in Boston!
course:
Three Length Options for the Ride:
19-mile ride
35-mile ride
62-mile ride
registration: Register online at our event website: http://events.r20.constantcontact.com/register/event?llr=egrgbgcab&oeidk=a07e3hepcm9000dd253&oseq=a0246igkvo19cq
directions: The ride starts and ends at The deCordova Museum in Lincoln, MA. Address is: 51 Sandy Pond Rd, Lincoln, MA 01773

title: MBRC Memorial Day Ride
description:
MBRC Memorial Day Ride
Plymouth, Ma to National Cemetery in Bourne, Ma
registration: Open to all riders.  No cost but you must have a helmet and sign waiver to participate
directions:
Start at the Plymouth 9-11 Memorial
1 South Spooner Street Plymouth, MA
Parking at 362 Court St
Limited Support & SAG Wagon

title: NAP Youth Cycling Series
description: Fun kids races on a grass surface, ages 5-12 with trike races for little ones.
course: Grass circuit, mostly flat with a few turns
notes: Look Park imposes a vehicle entry fee of $5, but it is free to enter by bicycle.  Races are free.
directions: Take route 9 three miles north from the center of Northampton.  Look Park will be on the left.

title: Attleboro Bicycling Criterium and Kids Grass Crit.
QuadCross 2011
description: Early Season Cyclocross race with events for beginners, women, and elite racers. This year adds a SingleSpeed event. The first event in the New England Single Speed Cyclocross Series. QuadCross is back for it\'s 5th year and known to many as the New England Cyclocross season opener. QuadCross returns on it\'s traditional date the first Sunday after Labor day.
course: Start on the soccer field, up a hill, through the finish line right into the sand pit, through the woods, long straight slightly downhill dirt road, 180 degree turn onto log skidder road, short up hill, somewhat sketchy downhill, more dirt road, over the bridge through the woods, a section under the power lines, more dirt road, down another road on the grass, a twisty turned section up some stairs left onto the off camber section more twists and turns up and down a bit and back to the start line.
registration:
Please register online at www.bikereg.com 
Day of registration is an extra $10
No mail in registration
Wondering which event you should register for, Email ted at ted.b.packard@gmail.com
No Refunds
Second Event only $15
notes: Food, Soda, and Beer will be for sale, no personal alcohol allowed.  No tents in the parking lot. Please put all club tents in the soccer field along the course. If dry there will be parking in the soccer field along the course. Parking will be tight. Please carpool, we are working on an overflow parking plan.  Details will be on Bikereg.com
directions:
From Rt 128 take MA-2 West	for 3.3 mile
Turn left onto MA-62 follow MA-62 for 4.2 mile
Turn left onto Waltham St for 0.5 mile
Turn left onto Old Mill Rd

title: Northeastern's Wild Western Mass MTB Weekend
Bike Fest 2011 Tour of the Valley
Boston Luna Chix Cyclocross Clinic w/Katerina Nash
Boston Road Club Shedd Park Cyclocross Race
Baystate Cyclocross
description:
BAYSTATE CYCLOCROSS Saturday UCI Cat 2 and Sunday NRC Verge Series races #12 & #13.

Presented by

The Mid State Cycling Club and Optimum Performance Cycling Clubs

STERLING, MA

Saturday, November 26, 2011 to Sunday, November 27, 2011
course:
The start of the race will be on the pavement next to the school. The Finish Line will be at the end of that straightaway of the running track. The course will follow the running track around to the right, down the back straight, around the final turn to the right. The course will turn off the running track with a sweeping left U turn onto grass followed by a steep climb to the high point of the course.  A long grass decent will be followed by a sweeping turn to a dismount up and over a retaining wall (the horse jump). A sweeping left turn will descend to a sandy grass field followed by a set of sweeping turns on a jeep track through trees. The course will then follow a long stretch on pavement, followed by a hard U turn to the left with a slight drop back on to grass. The course will then pass through one side of the double pit. The Pit Lane will be on the RIGHT.  Out of the Pit on a grass straight to a sweeping turn around to the right, make a turn up to the left and climb up a steep embankment and turn to the right. The course then cross a steep camber and descends back to above the running track. Follow the border of track around a sweeping turn on grass to the left. A U turn down an embankment will be followed by course going up and dropping down the embankment several times followed by a  cambered corner. The course will then drop back down the camber follow along the embankment base on grass, and make a left turn up the embankment. A right turn onto a level grass, go over a set of barriers and back up to the top of the embankment followed by another cambered corner. The course will then gradually descend to the low point of the course on grass. The course will then travel across short section of gravel lot and make a right and then a left turn onto playing field perimeter to a quick up/down/up turn on an embankment take a U turn to the left on grass to the 2nd Pit Zone between the playing field fence and the dirt parking lot. The Pit Lane will be on the RIGHT. After the Pit Zone the course will turn right and left, on level gravel for a few hundred meters, followed by a sweeping left urn on to a gradual climb on grass then onto a section of gravel lot, to the final right 90’ turn onto the cinder running track to the finish.
 
THE PIT ZONES WILL BE BACK TO BACK.
registration:
NO ENTRY REFUNDS WILL BE MADE. 
Entries may be traded up to pre-reg. close.

THERE WILL BE DAY OF RACE REGISTRATION
SATURDAY UCI CATEGORIES MUST BE PRE-REGISTERED.

THERE ARE NO FIELD LIMITS FOR THESE RACES.

2% of the UCI events prizes will be deducted for UCI Dope tax.
 
There is a $5 Day of Race Fee on entries.  Online entries end November 23, 20101at 12 noon. 

Enter online only at BikeReg.com or on race day at event.
notes:
Rules: Elite Men and Women must have a UCI license and use UCI legal cross bikes! Mountain bikes accepted in all other classes. No bar ends, aero bars, or sleeveless jerseys allowed. Helmets must be worn in all races. All races except Kids race – Bikes must have a working brake on each wheel and a rear freewheel. UCI events maximum tire width 33 mm. Tire width checks will be done at staging. Disc brakes are now allowed. USA Cycling license required.  One-day licenses can be purchased at registration for $10 for each day of racing.  Pre-registration is available online through BikeReg.com until Wednesday, November 24th.  Day of registration will be available from 7:00am Sat, 7:00am Sun until 1/4 hour before scheduled start time for all fields; a $5 day of registration fee will apply (except Juniors 10-14).  

Races may be combined if less than 10 riders are pre-registered for a class.  Riders in the Elite races will be pulled from the race per UCI rules; all other events are subject to the discretion of the chief referee.  Course will be open for warm-up in the morning until 15 minutes before the Cat 4 men race, and between the Cat 3/Junior U19 Men and Elite Women race; otherwise no warming up on the course at any time.
directions:
Directions:  FROM RT. 2: Take I 190 South. Take Rt. 12 South. Go through the center of Sterling. About 1.5 miles past the town center take a right onto Bean Rd. .2 miles. Go right onto Boutelle Rd. .2 miles to Chocksett School.
 
FROM THE MASS PIKE: Take I-290 towards Shrewsbury / Marlboro. Turn right onto ramp I-190 north. At exit 5, turn right onto ramp for .03 mi. Turn left onto SR-140 (North). Go straight through lights (Rt. 140 North) and turn right at first set of lights onto Dana Hill Rd. for approximately 0.5 mile. The name changes to Muddy Pond Rd. for 0.7 miles. Turn right after athletic fields onto Boutelle Rd. to the Middle School parking lots. Parking provided at the Chocksett Middle School.
 
FROM I-495: Take exit 29 onto Route 2 West for approximately 11.3 miles. At exit 33, take ramp (right) onto Mechanic Street for .05 mi towards I-190 South. Take I-190 South for 9.9 miles. Take exit 5, at the end of the ramp turn right onto SR-140 (North). Go straight through lights (Rt. 140 North) and turn right at first set of lights onto Dana Hill Rd. for approximately 0.5 mile. The name changes to Muddy Pond Rd. for 0.7 miles. Turn right after athletic fields onto Boutelle Rd. to the Middle School parking lots. Parking provided at the Chocksett Middle School.
